availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elijah Clore Snyder (Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Willis Snyder and Lucy Snyder. Married to Almyra P. Minor Snyder in Oldham County, Kentucky, on June 16, 1859. Father of Ida Snyder, Henry Snyder, Leon Snyder, and Lucy Snyder. Farmer in Oldham County in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860. Farmer in Oldham County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 142B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 902.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 172A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Brownsboro, p. 21B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Oldham County, KY, July 1863.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film 000482450.
"Elijah Clore Snyder (1828-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial 76152046, accessed March 29, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/76152046.
